title: Run bun install and verify dependency resolution
description:
## What

After all package.json version updates are complete (issues developer-t0y, developer-eeb, developer-y3z, developer-jgk, developer-ruf, developer-ke1, developer-2ai), run bun install to resolve and lock all dependencies.

## Why

We deliberately separate the 'edit package.json' step from the 'install' step so that:
1. All version changes can be reviewed together before installing
2. A single bun install resolves everything at once (faster, avoids intermediate broken states)
3. The lockfile (bun.lock) is updated atomically

## Implementation Steps

1. Run `bun install` in the project root
2. Verify no peer dependency warnings or conflicts in the output
3. Check that bun.lock was updated (it should show changes for all bumped packages)
4. Run `bunx playwright install` to download browser binaries matching Playwright 1.57
5. Run `astro check` (via `bun run astro check`) to verify TypeScript types still resolve
6. Run `bun run build` to verify the production build succeeds

## What Could Go Wrong

- **Peer dependency conflicts**: Starlight 0.37 might have stricter peer dep requirements on Astro version. Our Astro version (5.16.13) should satisfy it, but check.
- **astro-vtbot v2 import resolution**: After moving to devDependencies, verify the component imports in Head.astro still resolve at build time.
- **starlight-llms-txt v0.6 config**: The rawContent option might have a different API than expected. Verify the build doesn't error on this plugin.
- **Type errors**: astro check may surface new type issues from updated @types or stricter type exports.

## Success Criteria

- `bun install` completes without errors
- `astro check` passes (or only has pre-existing warnings)
- `bun run build` completes successfully
- No new console warnings about deprecated APIs

## Files

- bun.lock (auto-generated)
- No source file changes
close_reason: bun install, astro check, and bun run build all pass successfully. No peer dependency conflicts.

title: EPIC: Align Developer Portal with About Repo — Dependency Updates & Copy-to-Markdown
description:
## Overview

This epic brings the FashionUnited Developer Portal (/home/joost/fuww/developer) into alignment with the About/Handbook site (/home/joost/fuww/about) in two key areas:

1. **Dependency updates**: The developer repo has fallen behind the about repo on ~20+ shared dependencies. The about repo completed a major upgrade in commit a4299053 (Jan 23, 2026). We need to match those versions to stay on the same Astro/Starlight ecosystem baseline across all FashionUnited properties.

2. **Copy-to-Markdown feature**: The about repo added a 'Copy page' dropdown button on every documentation page (commit 30150cb0, Oct 20, 2025, bug-fixed in 599e8cf7 Feb 13, 2026). This lets users copy entire page content as Markdown (useful for LLMs, sharing, offline reference) or view the raw Markdown in a new tab. This feature should be consistent across all FashionUnited documentation sites.

## Why This Matters

- **Ecosystem consistency**: All FashionUnited Astro/Starlight sites should run on the same dependency baseline. Drift creates maintenance burden and makes porting features harder.
- **Developer experience**: The copy-to-markdown feature is particularly valuable for a *developer* portal — developers frequently need to share API docs, paste into LLM contexts, or reference documentation in issues/PRs.
- **LLM-friendly content**: Combined with the starlight-llms-txt plugin upgrade (0.2→0.6), this makes the developer docs fully LLM-accessible at page level (copy button) and site level (llms.txt).

## Scope

### In scope:
- All dependency version updates to match about repo
- astro-vtbot v1→v2 migration (dependency type change + config)
- starlight-llms-txt 0.2→0.6 migration (add rawContent option)
- PageTitle component with Copy Page dropdown
- Markdown API endpoint ([...slug].md.ts)
- Astro config registration of new component
- Build verification and E2E test pass

### Out of scope (noted for future work):
- Security middleware & CSP headers (about has middleware.ts; developer does not)
- StructuredData.astro for JSON-LD schemas
- SkipLink.astro for keyboard accessibility
- LastUpdated.astro freshness badges
- PageSidebar.astro maintainers card
- Vitest unit testing infrastructure
- Multi-browser Playwright expansion
- Content schema extensions (maintainers, needsReview, tokens)
- PostHog analytics integration

## Reference

- About repo: /home/joost/fuww/about
- About repo upgrade commit: a4299053 (Jan 23, 2026)
- About repo PageTitle commit: 30150cb0 (Oct 20, 2025)
- About repo copy button fix: 599e8cf7 (Feb 13, 2026)
- About repo vtbot migration: ce04b8d4

title: Create [...slug].md.ts markdown API endpoint

comments.author: Joost van der Laan
comments.text:
## Cross-References
- Parent epic: developer-8lb
- Blocks: developer-exi (PageTitle component)
- Parallel with: developer-q74 (constants.ts)

## Design Decisions

### Why a dynamic SSR route vs static pre-rendered?
The developer repo runs in SSR mode (output: 'server'). Using prerender=false means the markdown is always fresh — if someone edits a doc and restarts the server, the .md endpoint immediately reflects the change. For a developer portal where docs may be updated frequently (API changes, new endpoints), this freshness guarantee is valuable.

### Why not just use the DOM content?
We could have the copy button scrape the rendered HTML and convert it back to markdown. But:
1. That loses markdown structure (headers, code fences, links)
2. Conversion is lossy and error-prone
3. The Content Collection API gives us the EXACT source markdown
4. Raw markdown is more useful for LLMs than cleaned-up HTML

### Why text/plain instead of text/markdown?
The Content-Type header uses text/plain rather than text/markdown because:
1. text/markdown is not universally recognized by browsers
2. text/plain causes browsers to display the content directly (useful for 'View as Markdown')
3. The Clipboard API doesn't care about Content-Type — it writes the text body regardless

### Why getStaticPaths() is included
Even though prerender=false, Astro's type system expects getStaticPaths for [...slug] routes. It provides TypeScript type inference for the params object and serves as documentation of expected routes.

### 2. Dev Server Smoke Test

- [ ] Navigate to a documentation page (e.g., /docs/marketplace/graphql-api/)

### 3. Responsive Test
- [ ] At mobile viewport (<768px): button text hidden, only icon visible
- [ ] Dropdown menu repositions to left-aligned on mobile
- [ ] Dropdown is usable on touch devices

### 4. Dark Mode Test
- [ ] Toggle to dark mode
- [ ] Copy page button uses correct Starlight dark theme colors
- [ ] Dropdown menu uses correct dark theme colors
- [ ] No flash of unstyled content during theme toggle

### 5. E2E Tests
- [ ] `bunx playwright install` (if not done already — needed after Playwright version bump)
- [ ] `bun test:e2e` passes — existing tests still green
- [ ] No regressions in page loading, navigation, or content rendering

### 6. Markdown Endpoint Verification
- [ ] Directly visit /docs/marketplace/graphql-api.md in browser — raw markdown appears
- [ ] Visit /nonexistent-page.md — returns 404
- [ ] Markdown contains page content but NOT frontmatter YAML

### 7. LLMs.txt Verification
- [ ] Visit /llms.txt — structured site index appears
- [ ] Visit /llms-full.txt — full documentation as raw markdown (rawContent: true)
- [ ] No React component rendering errors in llms-full.txt output

## If Something Fails

- **Build error on vtbot**: Check that astro-vtbot is in devDependencies and the import was removed from astro.config.mjs
- **Build error on starlight-llms-txt**: Check that rawContent option syntax is correct
- **PageTitle not rendering**: Check that astro.config.mjs has the PageTitle component path correct
- **Markdown endpoint 404**: Check that the [...slug].md.ts file is in src/pages/ and prerender=false
- **Clipboard not working**: Clipboard API requires HTTPS or localhost — dev server should work
- **E2E tests fail on browser version**: Run `bunx playwright install` to update browsers

## Files

No file changes — this is a verification-only issue.

title: Migrate astro-vtbot v1 → v2
description:
## What

Migrate astro-vtbot from v1 (^1.8.2) to v2 (^2.1.10). This is a **major version bump** with specific migration steps.

## Breaking Changes in v2

1. **Dependency type change**: vtbot moves from `dependencies` to `devDependencies`. In v2, vtbot is a build-time-only tool — it doesn't need to be bundled in production. This reduces the production bundle size.

2. **Default options reversed**:
   - v1: `autoLint: true`, `loadingIndicator: true` (auto-injected)
   - v2: `autoLint: false`, `loadingIndicator: false` (must be explicit)
   - **Impact for us**: Our Head.astro already explicitly imports and renders LoadingIndicator, so this default change doesn't affect us. The component is included because we put it in our template, not because vtbot auto-injects it.

3. **Integration removal optional**: The about repo removed `import vtbot` and `vtbot()` from astro.config.mjs entirely. For basic Starlight usage, the integration is no longer needed — the components work standalone. However, keeping the integration is also fine (it still works in v2).

## How the About Repo Handled It

Commit ce04b8d4: Moved vtbot to devDependencies, updated version, removed from astro.config.mjs integrations. No changes needed to Head.astro — the component imports (`VtbotStarlight`, `LoadingIndicator`) remain identical.

## Implementation Steps

1. In package.json:
   - Remove `astro-vtbot` from `dependencies`
   - Add `astro-vtbot: "^2.1.10"` to `devDependencies`

2. In astro.config.mjs:
   - Remove `import vtbot from "astro-vtbot"` (line 9)
   - Remove `vtbot()` from the integrations array
   - This is the approach the about repo uses

3. In src/components/starlight/Head.astro:
   - **No changes needed** — the imports still work:
     - `import VtbotStarlight from "astro-vtbot/components/starlight/Base.astro"`
     - `import LoadingIndicator from "astro-vtbot/components/LoadingIndicator.astro"`

## Why Not Keep the Integration?

The vtbot() integration in v2 only provides:
- Dev toolbar inspection chamber
- Optional auto-lint
- Optional auto-injection of LoadingIndicator

Since we manually include LoadingIndicator and don't rely on auto-lint, removing the integration simplifies our config and matches the about repo's approach. The dev toolbar is minor and not used.

## Risk

MEDIUM — Major version bump, but our investigation confirmed all component APIs are unchanged. The about repo has been running v2 since January 2026. The key risk is forgetting to move the package to devDependencies.

## Files

- package.json (move between dep sections + version bump)
- astro.config.mjs (remove import + integration)
- src/components/starlight/Head.astro (NO CHANGES — verify only)
close_reason: Migrated astro-vtbot v1→v2: moved to devDependencies with ^2.1.10, removed vtbot integration from astro.config.mjs, Head.astro unchanged

## Cross-References
- Parent epic: developer-8lb
- Blocks: developer-34v (bun install verification)

## Key Insight
The reason vtbot moves to devDependencies in v2 is that the Astro build system inlines the component code at build time. The vtbot package is only needed during the build process (to resolve the imports), not at runtime. This is a common pattern in Astro where component libraries are dev-only because Astro compiles everything to static/server output.

title: Create PageTitle.astro component with Copy Page dropdown
description:
## What

Create `src/components/starlight/PageTitle.astro` — a custom Starlight component override that replaces the default page title with an enhanced version featuring a 'Copy page' dropdown menu.

## Feature Description

The dropdown appears next to every page's h1 title and offers two actions:

1. **Copy page** — Fetches the page's raw markdown from the .md endpoint and copies it to the clipboard using the Clipboard API. Shows 'Copied!' feedback for 2 seconds. Useful for pasting docs into LLM prompts, issues, PRs, or sharing.

2. **View as Markdown** — Opens the raw markdown in a new browser tab. Useful for reading the source, saving locally, or using with tools that consume plain text.

## Why This Matters for a Developer Portal

Developers are the primary audience for this site. They frequently:
- Paste API documentation into ChatGPT/Claude to ask questions about it
- Reference docs in GitHub issues and pull requests (markdown format is ideal)
- Feed documentation to code generation tools
- Share doc excerpts in Slack/Teams (markdown renders well in both)
- Use docs as context for their own documentation

The 'Copy page' button eliminates the friction of manually selecting, copying, and cleaning up page content. The markdown format is already structured and LLM-ready.

## Component Architecture

```
PageTitle.astro
├── <div.page-title-wrapper>     (flex container: title + button)
│   ├── <h1 id=PAGE_TITLE_ID>   (page title from Starlight route data)
│   └── <div.copy-page-container> (dropdown positioning context)
│       ├── <button.copy-page-button>  (trigger: icon + text + chevron)
│       └── <div.dropdown-menu>        (hidden by default)
│           ├── <button data-action='copy-markdown'>  (Copy page)
│           └── <button data-action='view-markdown'>  (View as Markdown)
├── <script>                      (client-side dropdown + clipboard logic)
└── <style>                       (scoped CSS using Starlight variables)
```

## Key Implementation Details

### Imports
```typescript
import { PAGE_TITLE_ID } from '../constants.ts';
const title = Astro.locals.starlightRoute.entry.data.title;
```

### Client-Side Behavior
- **Dropdown toggle**: Click button → show/hide menu, update aria-expanded
- **Outside click close**: Document click listener closes dropdown
- **Copy action**: Fetches `window.location.pathname.replace(/\/$/, '') + '.md'`, writes to clipboard
- **View action**: Opens the .md URL in \_blank tab
- **View transitions compatibility**: Listens to both DOMContentLoaded and astro:page-load (for Astro view transitions / vtbot navigation)
- **Listener deduplication**: Clones button node to prevent duplicate listeners on re-navigation

### Accessibility
- button has aria-label, aria-expanded, aria-haspopup='menu'
- dropdown has role='menu', aria-label
- menu items have role='menuitem'
- SVG icons have aria-hidden='true'
- Keyboard-navigable (native button elements)

### Styling
- Uses Starlight CSS custom properties (--sl-color-*) for theme consistency
- Respects dark mode automatically via Starlight variables
- Responsive: on mobile (<768px), button text hides (icon only), dropdown repositions from right-aligned to left-aligned
- Smooth transitions on hover (0.2s)
- z-index: 100 for dropdown overlay

### SVG Icons
Three inline SVGs used (no external icon library dependency):
1. Document icon (lines on page) — main button + copy action
2. Eye icon (circle in oval) — view action
3. Chevron down — dropdown indicator with hover animation

## Reference

Ported from: /home/joost/fuww/about/src/components/starlight/PageTitle.astro
Bug fix applied from: /home/joost/fuww/about commit 599e8cf7 (copy button visibility)

## Files

- src/components/starlight/PageTitle.astro (NEW)

comments.author: Joost van der Laan
comments.text:
## Cross-References
- Parent epic: developer-8lb
- Depends on: developer-q74 (constants.ts), developer-9tb (markdown endpoint)
- Blocks: developer-ypr (config registration)

## Design Decisions

### Why inline SVGs instead of Lucide icons?
The about repo uses inline SVGs rather than importing from lucide-react because:
1. Astro components (.astro) can render inline SVGs directly without React overhead
2. Only 3 simple icons are needed (document, eye, chevron) — no need for a full icon library import
3. Inline SVGs are smaller than component imports for small icon counts
4. They render during SSR without hydration — no JavaScript needed for icons

### Why clone the button to remove listeners?
The script uses `button.cloneNode(true)` + `replaceChild` to prevent duplicate event listeners. This is necessary because:
1. Astro view transitions re-run page scripts on navigation
2. The astro:page-load event fires on every navigation
3. Without deduplication, each navigation would add ANOTHER click listener
4. Cloning the node effectively removes all existing listeners before adding new ones

### Accessibility Rationale
The ARIA implementation follows the WAI-ARIA Menu Button pattern:
- Button: aria-haspopup='menu' (tells screen readers a menu will open)
- Button: aria-expanded (dynamically updated to reflect menu state)
- Menu: role='menu' (identifies the dropdown as a menu widget)
- Items: role='menuitem' (identifies each option as a menu action)
This ensures screen reader users can discover and operate the dropdown.

### Responsive Design Approach
On mobile (<768px):
- The 'Copy page' text is hidden, leaving only the document icon
- This keeps the button compact and doesn't compete with the page title for space
- The dropdown menu shifts from right-aligned to left-aligned to stay on screen
- The full dropdown text remains visible — only the trigger button is condensed

title: Create src/components/constants.ts shared constants file
description:
## What

Create a new file `src/components/constants.ts` that exports shared constants used by Starlight component overrides.

Initial content:
```typescript
// N.B. THIS FILE IS IMPORTED IN BOTH SERVER- AND CLIENT-SIDE CODE.
// THINK TWICE BEFORE ADDING STUFF AS IT WILL GET SHIPPED TO THE CLIENT.

export const PAGE_TITLE_ID = '_top';
```

## Why

The PAGE_TITLE_ID constant is used by the PageTitle component to set the id attribute on the h1 element. This id (`_top`) is a convention that:

1. Enables 'back to top' links to scroll to the page title
2. Is the standard anchor target for Starlight's table-of-contents '#' link
3. Matches the id that Starlight's default PageTitle component uses

Having it as a constant (rather than a magic string) ensures consistency if other components need to reference the page title element (e.g., for scroll-to-top buttons, accessibility skip links, or programmatic focus management).

## Design Decision: Why a Separate File?

The about repo places this in a standalone constants.ts rather than co-locating it in PageTitle.astro because:
- The comment warns it's imported in both server and client contexts
- Constants may be reused by future components (e.g., SkipLink.astro would reference PAGE_TITLE_ID)
- Keeps the PageTitle component focused on rendering logic

## Reference

Ported from: /home/joost/fuww/about/src/components/constants.ts

- src/components/constants.ts (NEW)

title: Upgrade starlight-llms-txt 0.2 → 0.6 with rawContent option
description:
## What

Update starlight-llms-txt from ^0.2.0 to ^0.6.1 and add the `rawContent: true` configuration option.

## Why

starlight-llms-txt generates /llms.txt, /llms-full.txt, and /llms-small.txt endpoints that make the entire site's documentation accessible to LLMs in a structured format. This is complementary to the per-page copy-to-markdown feature — llms-txt handles site-level access, copy-to-markdown handles page-level access.

Version 0.6 adds:
- `rawContent` option: Returns raw markdown instead of trying to render MDX/React components to HTML. This is CRITICAL for sites with React components in MDX — without it, llms-full.txt may fail or produce garbage when encountering JSX.
- `promote`/`demote` options: Control page ordering in generated txt files
- `pageSeparator` option: Custom separator between pages
- `customSets` support: Generate subset txt files for specific doc sections

## About Repo Experience

The about repo hit a bug where React components in MDX caused llms-full.txt rendering to fail. Commit 7be27ff3 (Feb 13, 2026) fixed this by adding `rawContent: true`. The developer repo also uses React components in MDX (the vortex component, shadcn/ui components), so we should proactively add this option.

## Implementation Steps

1. In package.json: Update `starlight-llms-txt` from `^0.2.0` to `^0.6.1`

2. In astro.config.mjs: Change the plugin configuration from:
```js
plugins: [starlightLlmsTxt()],
```
to:
```js
plugins: [
  starlightLlmsTxt({
    rawContent: true,
  }),
],
```

## Backward Compatibility

All existing v0.2 routes (/llms.txt, /llms-full.txt, /llms-small.txt) continue to work. The `rawContent` option is additive — it changes the content format of llms-full.txt from rendered HTML to raw markdown, which is actually what LLMs prefer.

## Risk

LOW — Backward compatible. The about repo has been running 0.6.1 since February 2026.

## Files

- package.json (version bump)
- astro.config.mjs (add rawContent option to starlightLlmsTxt plugin)

## LLM Content Strategy
This upgrade is part of a broader strategy to make FashionUnited documentation LLM-accessible at multiple levels:

1. **Site level**: /llms.txt provides a structured index of all documentation (starlight-llms-txt plugin)
2. **Full dump**: /llms-full.txt provides all docs in a single file (starlight-llms-txt with rawContent)
3. **Page level**: Individual page copy-to-markdown (PageTitle dropdown — separate issues)
4. **API level**: /[...slug].md endpoints for programmatic access (separate issue)

The rawContent: true option is essential because without it, React/MDX components in docs cause rendering failures in the llms-full.txt output.

title: Register PageTitle component override in astro.config.mjs
description:
## What

Update astro.config.mjs to tell Starlight to use our custom PageTitle component instead of its built-in default.

## Implementation

In the `starlight()` configuration object, add `PageTitle` to the `components` map:

```javascript
// Before:
components: {
  Head: './src/components/starlight/Head.astro',
},

// After:
components: {
  Head: './src/components/starlight/Head.astro',
  PageTitle: './src/components/starlight/PageTitle.astro',
},
```

## How Starlight Component Overrides Work

Starlight has a set of built-in components that render different parts of each documentation page (Head, PageTitle, Sidebar, Footer, etc.). By specifying a component path in the `components` config, Starlight renders YOUR component instead of its default.

The override is complete — Starlight passes all the same props and context (Astro.locals.starlightRoute) to custom components that it passes to its built-in ones. Our PageTitle.astro accesses the page title via `Astro.locals.starlightRoute.entry.data.title`.

## Why This is a Separate Issue

This is the 'activation' step — without this config change, the PageTitle.astro file exists but is never rendered. Keeping it separate from the component creation makes it easy to:
- Review the component independently of the config change
- Quickly disable the feature by reverting just this config line
- Debug issues by checking 'is the component registered?' vs 'is the component broken?'

## Reference

The about repo registers this in the same way, along with several other overrides:
```javascript
// about repo astro.config.mjs
components: {
  Head: './src/components/starlight/Head.astro',
  SocialIcons: './src/components/NavLink.astro',
  PageTitle: './src/components/starlight/PageTitle.astro',
}
```

## Files

- astro.config.mjs (modify components object)

comments.author: Joost van der Laan
comments.text:
## Cross-References
- Parent epic: developer-8lb
- Depends on: developer-exi (PageTitle component)
- Blocks: developer-dx8 (final verification)

## Starlight Override System Context
Starlight's component override system works by mapping component names to file paths in the config. The component names correspond to Starlight's internal rendering slots. Available override points include:

- Head, PageTitle, Sidebar, TableOfContents, Footer, Hero, etc.

Currently, the developer repo only overrides Head (for vtbot view transitions). After this change, it will override both Head and PageTitle.

## Rollback Strategy
If the copy-to-markdown feature causes issues in production:
1. Remove the PageTitle line from astro.config.mjs components
2. Rebuild and deploy
3. Starlight reverts to its default PageTitle component
4. The PageTitle.astro file and constants.ts can remain in the codebase (they're just unused)
5. The .md endpoint also becomes unused but is harmless

This single-line config change is the on/off switch for the entire feature.
